newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS - PRESS DIGEST - Australian Sports News - Jan 20.
newsitem.headline: RTRS - PRESS DIGEST - Australian Sports News - Jan 20.

text.p: THE AUSTRALIAN

South African Amanda Coetzer defeated world number one women's tennis player Steffi Graf yesterday in the fourth round of the Australian Tennis Open at Melbourne Park 6-2, 7-5. The defeat was the first Graf has suffered in a Grand Slam event since the US Open in 1994, and she was hindered by back pain, stifling conditions and a gallant opponent. Page 25.

West Indian cricket team manager Clive Lloyd said yesterday there are several injury worries in the team, including that of champion bowler Curtly Ambrose. His team's attempt of a revival in the five-Test series against Australia could be derailed with further injuries to Kenny Benjamin and Nixon Maclean, who have been sent home. Page 25.

Australian rugby union hooker Phil Kearns is back on crutches, suffering a bruised bone in his knee and has been ordered not to run for another fortnight. Kearns will cycle, swim and row in an effort to get fit for the Super 12 series that kicks off in six weeks. Page 27.
THE SYDNEY MORNING HERALD

The Australian soccer team defeated New Zealand 1-0 under new coach Terry Venables at Lakeside Stadium in Melbourne on Saturday night. The match, the first in the four-nation World Series, was a test for the much-heralded Venables, who admitted it did no follow the game plan. Page 26.
Australian Cricket Board chairman Graham Halbish is expected to take legal action against the ACB for his sacking last week.
Page 27.

Australian boxer Kostya Tzsyu defended his International Boxing Federation junior welterweight title against Puerto Rican Leonardo Mas in Las Vegas, yet the match was called a technical draw after one round by referee Joe Cortez, because an unintentional llegal blow from Tszyu left Mas unable to continue. Page 28.
THE AGE

Australian wicket-keeper Ian Healy is considering standing back from the stumps while wrist spinner Michael Bevan bowls in the fourth Test match against the West Indies in Adelaide. It is unusual for any wicket keeper to stand away from the stumps for a spinner, but Healy believes it will add to the potency of Bevan. Page 8.

Australian golfer Karrie Webb is tied for the lead of the US LPGA's Healthsouth Inaugural in Orlando Florida after birdying three of the last five holes in the third round. Webb is tied with Michelle McGann at six under 138, two strokes ahead of England'sJoanne Morley. Page 9.

Alan Iacuone won the five day Motorola Mt Buller Cup in Victoria, Australia yesterday. Iacuone used lettuce leaves under his helmet to keep cool in temperatures of 42 degrees Celsius to win from New Zealander Brendan Vesty in the five-day event. Page 15.
THE HERALD SUN

Australian ironman Scott Reeves won the Uncle Tobys Super ironman series at Portsea, Victoria yesterday. Reeves came fourth in the pursuit format race to win the series with one race to go. Reeves, the most consistent competitor all year, only overcame a dysfunctional liver problem two months ago. Page 124.

The Melbourne Monarchs only have a mathematical chance of making the Australian Baseball League playoffs after losing 6-0 in an extra-innings game against the Gold Coast Cougars. The Monarchs owner David Oertle, and manager Jon Deeble were upset at home plate umpires for calls they felt decided the game. Page 117.

Five-year-old harness racing star Roaring Boss holds an Australian record unbeaten-stretch of seven after winning at Moonee Valley last Saturday night. Trainer-driver John Crofts is resting the horse for the Adelaide Inter Dominion, skipping the Australaian Trotting Championship on February 22. Page 115.
THE DAILY TELEGRAPH

Selectors of the Australian test team have replaced injured fast bowler Jason Gillespie with Andrew Bichel for the fourth match against the West Indies in Adelaide on Saturday. The selectors resisted making more changes to the team that lost the third Test match in three days to the Windies. Bichel will make his Test debut in Adelaide, with injured bowler Paul Reiffel yet to prove his fitness. Page 29.

Australian triathlete Brad White won the opening round of the three-event Avia Sprint series at Pier One yesterday in only his first season as a triathlete. White was nine seconds in front of Jonathan Hall with a time of 37 min, 58 sec. In the women's secion Andra Boyle of Sydney won for the first time, five months after taking up the sport. Page 34.

Australian champion sailors Darren Bundock and John Forbes won the Tornado regatta at Sail Melbourne over the weekend, just 2.75 points ahead of old rival Mitch Booth and Adam Beashel. It was the first meeting of the crews in Tornado Catamarans since Bundck and Forbes missed out on Olympic selection. Page 40.
